results.title: Spaceship Earth
results.creator_credit: Mike Kleinsteuber, John Selwyn Gilbert, Channel Four, Antelope Films and Network Television
results.brief_description: A series allowing the viewer to tour the earth with the aid of remote sensing technology. Combined with modern computing power, space technology is helping scientists to create a new global geography, in order to discover how our life support systems work and how natural and human forces change them.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mike Kleinsteuber, John Selwyn Gilbert, Channel Four, Antelope Films and Network Television

results.title: When a job becomes a passion
results.creator_credit: John Balsillie, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Major John Balsillie was first posted to Malaya during World War II, he became interested in World War II research and military history. It soon developed into a passion and he shipped off over 20 crates of war relics to the Australian War Memorial in Canberra. He talks of his subsequent visits during the 1960s and the second time he served, in Vietnam. This interest became a lifelong passion for John, for which he was recently awarded an MBE for services to the Australian War Memorial. John sees his role as providing a record of the brave soldiers who gave their lives for Australia.

results.title: Special Effects
results.brief_description: This thoroughly entertaining program takes the viewer on a behind the scenes look at such special effects blockbusters as “Blade Runner”, “The Right Stuff”, “The Empire Strikes Back” and “Return of the Jedi” along with examples of the latest work being done in computer generated imagery, video games and sound effects. Narrated by Robin King.

results.title: Arkady Leokum's Tell Me Why
results.brief_description: Based on the best selling book series by Arkady Leokum this series of videos answers questions that children commonly ask on a wide variety of subjects. Colourful graphics and exciting film footage combined with quick search numbers on screen make this an easy to use and fun learning tool.

results.title: Special delivery
results.creator_credit: Eunice Macaulay, John Weldon, Derek Lamb and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Special Delivery looks like a detective story and sounds like a soap opera. A series of misadventures stretches the imagination to its limits, as Alice and Ralph Phelps battle with the snow and the dead mailman. A comic moral tale which warns of the perils of the slippery slope! Winner of the 1979 Academy Award for Best Animated Short.

results.title: Sense of guilt
results.creator_credit: Robert English, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A psychological portrait of a man who’s life has been marred by the horrors of war, as seen by his son. The English family were aware that when George English came back to Australia after the war he was a changed man but it wasn’t until son Robert volunteered to go to Vietnam that feelings George couldn’t disguise any longer came to the fore. In telling his story of his voyage back to Australia and their detour through Java. it became clear that George had been hiding the profound sense of guilt about surviving the war when many of his colleagues didn’t.

results.title: Speaking our peace
results.creator_credit: Margaret Pettigrew, Bonnie Sherr Klein and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A documentary about women, peace and power. Greenham Common, England, was once land belonging to the entire community and used for its common good. Now nine miles of wire fences divide the US Airforce Base from the women and the children they claim to protect. The land is home to 32 guided missiles. Women came to Greenham to challenge the belief that the peace we seek can come from any army. Women speak out in opposition to nuclear weapons.

results.title: Rwanda
results.creator_credit: Joanne Harding, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Joanne Harding was sent to Rwanda as part of the Australian Defence Force medical Support Force. She focuses on the part of her experience that affected her the most, the eyes of the children. She describes their eyes as pools of nothingness as they begin to accept war as part of their everyday life. In turn, Joanne begins to question the effectiveness of her role and that of the United Nations in bringing peace to this wartorn country.

results.title: Monkey off my back
results.creator_credit: Ned Jeanes, Jack Gerdsen and ACMI
results.brief_description: Jack Gerdsen recounts his emotional return to the battleground in Korea 44 years later. He took with him soil from his backyard to honour and comfort his mates who fell there.
